intro: Bollea, commonly known as the "sea holly," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flower heads. The plant features silver-gray foliage with spiny margins, giving it a distinctive and somewhat prickly appearance. Bollea thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing along coastal areas. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
